intro: Justicia moorei, commonly known as the flame flower, is a tropical shrub native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. The plant has lance-shaped, dark green leaves that are opposite in arrangement, providing a lush backdrop to its vibrant blooms. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Justicia moorei is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
